titles.title: Anti-Ballistic Missile System Development Limitation Act of 1987

A bill to prohibit the obligation and expenditure of funds appropriated or made available to the Department of Defense during fiscal years 1988 and 1989 for the development or testing of anti-ballistic missile systems or components which are sea-based, air-based, space-based, or mobile land-based.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Armed Services.

bill.summary: 5/15/1987--Introduced. Anti-Ballistic Missile System Development Limitation Act of 1987 - Prohibits the obligation or expenditure of funds appropriated or made available to the Department of Defense during FY 1988 and 1989 for the development or testing of anti-ballistic missile systems or components which are sea-based, air-based, space-based, or mobile land-based. Terminates such prohibition when: (1) the President reports to the Congress on the systems or components proposed to be developed or tested; and (2) after such report is received, a joint resolution specifically repealing this Act is enacted.
